title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab.
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, no children nodes are listed. After closing the data set editor and reopening it, the issue persists.
EB: The data set editor in the query tab should display the children nodes when the data source is changed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 
2. Open the data set editor in the query tab. 
3. In the data set editor data source page, change the data source. 
4. Ensure that the new data source does not have any database, table, or column information. 
5. Observe that there are no children nodes listed. 
6. Close the data set editor and reopen it to confirm that the issue persists.
